Colonel Jones
SECRET.
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON 6th JUNE, 1918.
The general situation is unchanged. The French carried out a local operation in the neighbourhood of TROESNES which enabled them to occupy the wood north-east of MOSLOY and HILL 106, south of TROESNES. On the rest of the CHAMPAGNE front, with the exception of patrol encounters, no operations of any importance have taken place.
2. On the British front the enemy attempted raids in the neighbourhood of MORLANCOURT, BOYELLLES, north of LENS, north of BETHUNE, and east of the NIEPPE FOREST. All these raids were repulsed and casualties inflicted on the enemy.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
6th June, 1918.
Issued at 12.35 p.m.
